intro: Psychotria pendula subsp. pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of forests. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that are often arranged in whorls around the stem. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have a white or pale purple coloration. This subspecies is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal and ecological significance.
